verses.verse: desiring to be teachers of the law, understanding neither what they say nor the things which they affirm.
But we know that the law is (Rom. 7:12, 16) good if one uses it lawfully,

knowing this: that the law is not made for a righteous person, but for the lawless and insubordinate, for the ungodly and for sinners, for the unholy and profane, for murderers of fathers and murderers of mothers, for manslayers,
for fornicators, for sodomites, for kidnappers, for liars, for perjurers, and if there is any other thing that is contrary to sound doctrine,
according to the glorious gospel of the (1 Tim. 6:15) blessed God which was (1 Cor. 9:17) committed to my trust.
(Glory to God for His Grace) And I thank Christ Jesus our Lord who has (1 Cor. 15:10) enabled me, (1 Cor. 7:25) because He counted me faithful, (Col. 1:25) putting me into the ministry,
although (Acts 8:3; 1 Cor. 15:9) I was formerly a blasphemer, a persecutor, and an insolent man; but I obtained mercy because (John 4:21) I did it ignorantly in unbelief.

(Rom. 5:20; 1 Cor. 3:10; 2 Cor. 4:15; Gal. 1:13-16) And the grace of our Lord was exceedingly abundant, (1 Thess. 1:3; 1 Tim. 2:15; 4:12; 6:11; 2 Tim. 1:13; 2:22; Titus 2:2) with faith and love which are in Christ Jesus.

(1 Tim. 3:1; 4:9; 2 Tim. 2:11; Titus 3:8) This is a faithful saying and worthy of all acceptance, that (Is. 53:5; 61:1; Hos. 6:1-3; Matt. 1:21; 9:13) Christ Jesus came into the world to save sinners, of whom I am chief.
However, for this reason I obtained mercy, that in me first Jesus Christ might show all longsuffering, as a pattern to those who are going to believe on Him for everlasting life.
Now to (Ps. 10:16) the King eternal, (Rom. 1:23) immortal, (Heb. 11:27) invisible, to God (Rom. 16:27) who alone is wise, (1 Chr. 29:11) be honor and glory forever and ever. Amen.
(Fight the Good Fight) This charge I commit to you, son Timothy, according to the prophecies previously made concerning you, that by them you may wage the good warfare,
having faith and a good conscience, which some having rejected, concerning the faith have suffered shipwreck,
of whom are (2 Tim. 2:17, 18) Hymenaeus and (2 Tim. 4:14) Alexander, whom I delivered to Satan that they may learn not to (Acts 13:45) blaspheme.
(Pray for All Men) Therefore I exhort first of all that supplications, prayers, intercessions, and giving of thanks be made for all men,
